00044 /**
00045  * Constructor
00046  */
00047 CelExtractOptions::CelExtractOptions()
00048 {
00049   /* Some defaults... */
00050   verbosity = 1;
00051   force = false;
00052   pmOnly = false;
00053   pairWithBackground = false;
00054   ignoreProbesWithoutMM = false;
00055   subtractBackground = false;
00056   useDisk = true;
00057   diskCache = 50;
00058   m_output_precision=2;
00059 }
00060

00064 CelExtractOptions::~CelExtractOptions()
00065 {
00066 }

00069  * Destructor.

00073 /**
00074  * Check options.
00075  */
00076 void CelExtract::checkOptions(CelExtractOptions &o)
00077 {
00078   // make sure we have cel file
00079   if (o.celFiles.size() < 1)
00080     Err::errAbort("Must provide at least 1 cel file.");
00081 
00082   // do we have chip layout info
00083   bool haveLayout = !(o.pgfFile == "" && o.cdfFile == "" && o.spfFile == "");
00084 
00085   // need library file if using probe id or probeset id file
00086   if (!haveLayout && (o.probesetIdsFiles.size() != 0 || o.probeIdsFiles.size() != 0))
00087     Err::errAbort("Must provide chip layout information (ie cdf, spf or pgf/clf file) when using probe or probeset list.");
00088 
00089   // user must specify outFile
00090   if (o.outFile == "")
00091     Err::errAbort("Must provide an output file.");
00092 
00093   // pgf needs clf
00094   if (o.pgfFile != "" && o.clfFile == "")
00095     Err::errAbort("Must provide a clf file when using pgf file.");
00096 
00097   // only pgf or cdf not both
00098   if (o.pgfFile != "" && o.cdfFile != "")
00099     Err::errAbort("Cannot provide both a CDF and a PGF file.");
00100 
00101   // cannot request pmOnly if no layout file
00102   if (o.pmOnly && !haveLayout)
00103     Err::errAbort("Must provide chip layout information (ie cdf, spf or pgf/clf file) when using PM only option.");
00104 
00105   // cannot request itnoreProbesWithoutMM if no layout file
00106   if (o.ignoreProbesWithoutMM && !haveLayout)
00107     Err::errAbort("Must provide chip layout information (ie cdf, spf or pgf/clf file) when using PM with MM only option.");
00108 
00109   // must have layout to do analysis
00110   if (o.analysisString != "" && !haveLayout)
00111     Err::errAbort("Must provide layout information (ie cdf, spf or pgf/clf file) when requesting an analysis.");
00112 
00113   // cannot request pairWithBackground if no layout and no analysis stream
00114   if ((o.pairWithBackground || o.subtractBackground) && !haveLayout)
00115     Err::errAbort("Must provide chip layout information (ie cdf, spf or pgf/clf file) when using one of the background options.");
00116 
00117   // cannot request pairWithBackground if no analysis
00118   if ((o.pairWithBackground || o.subtractBackground) && o.analysisString == "")
00119     Err::errAbort("Must provide an analysis string when using one of the background options.");
00120 
00121   // cannot request both options
00122   if (o.pairWithBackground && o.subtractBackground)
00123     Err::errAbort("You cannot request background values to both be reported and subtracted.");
00124 
00125   // have to have an analysis string to use with target-sketch-file
00126   if (o.sketchInFile.size() && ! o.analysisString.size()) {
00127     Err::errAbort("The --analysis option must be used when specifying an input target-sketch-file");
00128   }
00129 
00130   // chip type cel files all match
00131   if (o.force) {
00132     Verbose::out(1, "Force option given, skipping chip type checks.");
00133   } else {
00134     Verbose::out(1, "Checking chip type on all cel files.");
00135     vector<string> chipTypes;
00136     colrow_t numRows, numCols;
00137     int probeCount;
00138     int probeSetCount;
00139 
00140     if (o.cdfFile != "") {
00141       EngineUtil::getCdfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, probeSetCount, o.cdfFile);
00142     } else if (o.pgfFile != "") {
00143       EngineUtil::getPgfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, o.pgfFile, o.clfFile);
00144     } else if (o.spfFile != "") {
00145       EngineUtil::getSpfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, probeSetCount, o.spfFile);
00146     } else {
00147       FusionCELData cel;
00148       cel.SetFileName(o.celFiles[0].c_str());
00149       if (!cel.ReadHeader())
00150         Err::errAbort("Cannot read cel file: " + o.celFiles[0]);
00151       chipTypes.push_back(StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetChipType()));
00152       if (chipTypes[0] == "")
00153         Err::errAbort("Unable to get chip type from cel file " + o.celFiles[0]);
00154       numCols = cel.GetCols();
00155       numRows = cel.GetRows();
00156       probeCount = numCols * numRows;
00157       cel.Close();
00158     }
00159     EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(chipTypes, probeCount, o.celFiles, numRows, numCols);
00160   }
00161 }
00162 
00163 /**
00164  * Constructor.
00165  */
00166 CelExtract::CelExtract(CelExtractOptions &o)
00167 {
00168   checkOptions(o);
00169   m_as = NULL;
00170   m_asFactory = NULL;
00171   m_FirstCelColIndex = 0;
00172 
00173   // make a copy of our options
00174   m_Options = o;
00175 
00176   // figure out basic stats from CEL file
00177   FusionCELData cel;
00178   cel.SetFileName(o.celFiles[0].c_str());
00179   if (!cel.ReadHeader()) {
00180     Err::errAbort("Cannot read cel file: " + o.celFiles[0]);
00181   }
00182   m_NumCols = cel.GetCols();
00183   m_NumRows = cel.GetRows();
00184   m_NumFeatures = m_NumCols * m_NumRows;
00185   m_NumChannels = cel.GetChannels().size();
00186   if (m_NumChannels == 0) {
00187     // not a multi-channel CEL file; treat as a single-channel CEL file
00188     m_NumChannels = 1;
00189   }
00190   cel.Close();
00191 
00192   m_OutFiles.resize(m_NumChannels, o.outFile);
00193   if (m_NumChannels > 1) {
00194     for (int channelIx = 0; channelIx < m_NumChannels; channelIx++) {
00195       m_OutFiles[channelIx].append(".channel" + ToStr(channelIx));
00196     }
00197   }
00198 
00199   Verbose::out(1, "Expecting " + ToStr(m_NumCols) + " columns and " +
00200                ToStr(m_NumRows) + " rows in each CEL file.");
00201 
00202   /// what probesets to load, we leave this empty == load all
00203   /// or fill in to restrict if probeset list file given
00204   set<const char *, Util::ltstr> probeSetsToLoad;
00205 
00206   for (int i = 0; i < m_NumFeatures; i++)
00207     m_ProbesToDump.push_back(false);
00208 
00209   // set from probe file
00210   if (o.probeIdsFiles.size() != 0) {
00211     int count = 0;
00212     vector<probeid_t> probesToExtract;
00213     for (int i = 0;i < o.probeIdsFiles.size();i++) {
00214       Verbose::out(1, "Loading probes to extract from: " + o.probeIdsFiles[i]);
00215       EngineUtil::readProbeFile(probesToExtract, o.probeIdsFiles[i]);
00216     }
00217     for (int i = 0; i < probesToExtract.size(); i++) {
00218       if (probesToExtract[i] >= m_NumFeatures)
00219         Err::errAbort("Invalid probe ID requested, " + ToStr(probesToExtract[i]));
00220       if (probesToExtract[i] < 0)
00221         Err::errAbort("Invalid probe ID requested, " + ToStr(probesToExtract[i]));
00222       m_ProbesToDump[probesToExtract[i]] = true;
00223       count++;
00224     }
00225     Verbose::out(1, "Loaded " + ToStr(count) + " probes.");
00226   }
00227   // set from probeset file
00228   vector<string> psVec;
00229   if (o.probesetIdsFiles.size() != 0) {
00230     for (int i = 0;i < o.probesetIdsFiles.size();i++) {
00231       Verbose::out(1, "Loading probesets to extract from: " + o.probesetIdsFiles[i]);
00232       EngineUtil::readProbeSetFile(psVec, o.probesetIdsFiles[i]);
00233     }
00234     for (int i = 0; i < psVec.size(); i++)
00235       probeSetsToLoad.insert(psVec[i].c_str());
00236     Verbose::out(1, "Will load " + ToStr(probeSetsToLoad.size()) + " probesets.");
00237   }
00238   // set default list of probe IDs from cel file
00239   if ((o.probeIdsFiles.size() == 0) && (o.probesetIdsFiles.size()) == 0) {
00240     Verbose::out(1, "Defaulting to extract all probes.");
00241     for (int i = 0; i < m_NumFeatures; i++)
00242       m_ProbesToDump[i] = true;
00243   }
00244 
00245   // load up layout
00246   m_Layout = NULL;
00247   /// what probes to ignore, we leave this empty == none to kill
00248   probeidmap_t killList;
00249   /// what probeset types (ie genotype) to load, we leave this empty == load all
00250   set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> psTypesToLoad;
00251 
00252   // make sure gc control probes get loaded, if requested
00253   std::vector<bool> probesToLoad = m_ProbesToDump;
00254   if (o.bgpFile != "") {
00255     int count = 0;
00256     Verbose::out(1, "Loading probes to extract from " + o.bgpFile);
00257     vector<probeid_t> bgpProbes;
00258     EngineUtil::readProbeFile(bgpProbes, o.bgpFile.c_str());
00259     for (int i = 0; i < bgpProbes.size(); i++) {
00260       if (bgpProbes[i] >= m_NumFeatures)
00261         Err::errAbort("Invalid probe ID requested, " + ToStr(bgpProbes[i]));
00262       if (bgpProbes[i] < 0)
00263         Err::errAbort("Invalid probe ID requested, " + ToStr(bgpProbes[i]));
00264       count++;
00265       probesToLoad[bgpProbes[i]] = true;
00266       m_ProbeOrder.push_back(bgpProbes[i]);
00267     }
00268     Verbose::out(1, "Loaded " + ToStr(count) + " bgp probes.");
00269   }
00270 
00271   if (o.cdfFile != "" || o.pgfFile != "" || o.spfFile != "") {
00272     m_Layout = new ChipLayout;
00273     m_Layout->setNeedGc(true);
00274     m_Layout->setNeedMismatch(true);
00275   }
00276 
00277   if (o.cdfFile != "") {
00278     Verbose::out(1, "Opening layout file: " + o.cdfFile);
00279     if (!m_Layout->openCdf(o.cdfFile, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, probesToLoad, "", killList, false, psTypesToLoad))
00280       Err::errAbort("Could not open layout file " + o.cdfFile);
00281     Verbose::out(1, "Done loading chip layout info.");
00282   } else if (o.pgfFile != "") {
00283     Verbose::out(1, "Opening layout file: " + o.clfFile);
00284     affx::ClfFile clf;
00285     if (!clf.open(o.clfFile))
00286       Err::errAbort("Could not open layout file " + o.clfFile);
00287     /* Make sure our assumptions about CLF file are true */
00288     Err::check(clf.getSequential() == 1,
00289                "ProbesetSummarizeEngine::loadPgfLayout() - unable to handle clf file without sequential set to 1.");
00290     Err::check(clf.getOrder().compare("col_major") == 0 || clf.getOrder().compare("row_major") == 0,
00291                "Unable to handle clf file without order set to row_major (old mislabeled 'col_major' accepted due to earlier bug.)");
00292 
00293     Verbose::out(1, "Opening layout file: " + o.pgfFile);
00294     if (!m_Layout->openPgf(o.pgfFile.c_str(), clf.getXMax() + 1, clf.getYMax() + 1, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, NULL, probesToLoad, "", killList, false, false))
00295       Err::errAbort("Could not open layout file " + o.pgfFile);
00296     Verbose::out(1, "Done loading chip layout info.");
00297   } else if (o.spfFile != "") {
00298     Verbose::out(1, "Opening layout file: " + o.spfFile);
00299     m_Layout->openSpf(o.spfFile, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, probesToLoad, "", false, psTypesToLoad);
00300     Verbose::out(1, "Done loading chip layout info.");
00301   } else {
00302     Verbose::out(1, "No chip layout information available. Doing basic extraction.");
00303   }
00304 
00305   // now we need to flag the probes in the requested probesets
00306   // to be dumped
00307   if (o.probesetIdsFiles.size() != 0) {
00308     Verbose::out(1, "Flagging probes from requested probesets to be extracted.");
00309     assert(m_Layout);
00310     set<const char *, Util::ltstr>::iterator iter;
00311     for (iter = probeSetsToLoad.begin(); iter != probeSetsToLoad.end(); iter++) {
00312       ProbeListPacked pList = m_Layout->getProbeListByName(*iter);
00313       if (pList.isNull()) {
00314         Verbose::out(1, "Unable to find probeset " + ToStr(*iter) + " in layout file. Skipping.");
00315       } else {
00316         ProbeSet *ps = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(pList);
00317         //printf("m_PsOrder_jhg:1: %d\n",m_Layout->getProbeSetIndexByName(*iter));
00318         m_PsOrder_jhg.push_back(m_Layout->getProbeSetIndexByName(*iter));
00319         for (int aIx = 0; aIx < ps->atoms.size(); aIx++)
00320           for (int plIx = 0; plIx < ps->atoms[aIx]->probes.size(); plIx++) {
00321             m_ProbesToDump[ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id] = true;
00322             m_ProbeOrder.push_back(ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id);
00323           }
00324         Freez(ps);
00325       }
00326     }
00327   } else if (m_Layout != NULL) {
00328     // iterate over everything in the layout
00329     for (int psIx = 0; psIx < m_Layout->getProbeSetCount(); psIx++) {
00330       ProbeListPacked pList = m_Layout->getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
00331       ProbeSet *ps = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(pList);
00332       //printf("m_PsOrder_jhg:2: %d\n",m_Layout->getProbeSetIndexByName(ps->name));
00333       m_PsOrder_jhg.push_back(m_Layout->getProbeSetIndexByName(ps->name));
00334       for (int aIx = 0; aIx < ps->atoms.size(); aIx++)
00335         for (int plIx = 0; plIx < ps->atoms[aIx]->probes.size(); plIx++)
00336           m_ProbeOrder.push_back(ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id);
00337       Freez(ps);
00338     }
00339   }
00340 
00341   // does the user only want a certain type of probe
00342   if (o.pmOnly || o.ignoreProbesWithoutMM) {
00343     if (o.ignoreProbesWithoutMM)
00344       Verbose::out(1, "Figuring out which probes are PM with MM to restrict extraction.");
00345     else if (o.pmOnly)
00346       Verbose::out(1, "Figuring out which probes are PM to restrict extraction.");
00347     assert(m_Layout);
00348     // swap probes to dump - we need to know what is true so far
00349     vector<bool> originalProbesToDump(m_NumFeatures, false);
00350     m_ProbesToDump.swap(originalProbesToDump);
00351     // iterate over everything in the layout
00352     for (int psIx = 0; psIx < m_Layout->getProbeSetCount(); psIx++) {
00353       ProbeListPacked pList = m_Layout->getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
00354       ProbeSet *ps = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(pList);
00355       for (int aIx = 0; aIx < ps->atoms.size(); aIx++) {
00356         for (int plIx = 0; plIx < ps->atoms[aIx]->probes.size(); plIx++) {
00357           if (o.ignoreProbesWithoutMM) {
00358             // if has MM and is PM and was true before, set true
00359             if (ps->hasMM() && Probe::isPm(*(ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]))) {
00360               if (originalProbesToDump[ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id] == true)
00361                 m_ProbesToDump[ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id] = true;
00362             }
00363           } else if (o.pmOnly) {
00364             // if is PM and was true before, set true
00365             if (Probe::isPm(*(ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]))) {
00366               if (originalProbesToDump[ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id] == true)
00367                 m_ProbesToDump[ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id] = true;
00368             }
00369           }
00370         }
00371       }
00372       Freez(ps);
00373     }
00374   }
00375   Verbose::out(1, "Done with extraction setup.");
00376 }
00377 
00378 void CelExtract::defineExtractTsv(std::vector<affx::TsvFile*>& tsv, bool bDoSaturationReport/*=false*/)
00379 {
00380 
00381   for (int f = 0; f < tsv.size(); f++) {
00382     tsv[f] = new affx::TsvFile();
00383     int columnCount = 0;
00384 
00385     // add some nice header info
00386     tsv[f]->addHeader("program", "apt-cel-extract");
00387     tsv[f]->addHeader("command-line",m_Options.commandLine);
00388     tsv[f]->addHeader("exec-guid",m_Options.execGuid);
00389 
00390     //
00391     if (m_Layout != NULL) {
00392       tsv[f]->addHeader("num-cols", int(m_Layout->m_XCount));
00393       tsv[f]->addHeader("num-rows", int(m_Layout->m_YCount));
00394     }
00395     else {
00396       tsv[f]->addHeader("num-features", m_NumFeatures);
00397       tsv[f]->addHeader("num-cols", m_NumCols);
00398       tsv[f]->addHeader("num-rows", m_NumRows);
00399     }
00400 
00401     // full input path.
00402     for (int i = 0; i < m_Options.celFiles.size(); i++) {
00403       tsv[f]->addHeader("input-" + ToStr(i), m_Options.celFiles[i]);
00404     }
00405 
00406     // primary key
00407         if (bDoSaturationReport == false)
00408         {
00409                 tsv[f]->defineColumn(0, columnCount++, "probe_id");
00410                 tsv[f]->defineColumn(0, columnCount++, "x");
00411                 tsv[f]->defineColumn(0, columnCount++, "y");
00412         }
00413         else
00414         {
00415                 tsv[f]->defineColumn (0, columnCount++, "fraction_of_features_saturated", TSV_TYPE_FLOAT);
00416         }
00417     // set up probe annotations column labels
00418     if (m_Layout != NULL) {
00419       tsv[f]->defineColumn(0, columnCount++, "probe_type");
00420       tsv[f]->defineColumn(0, columnCount++, "probeset_id");
00421       tsv[f]->defineColumn(0, columnCount++, "probeset_type");
00422       tsv[f]->defineColumn(0, columnCount++, "block");
00423     }
00424 
00425     m_FirstCelColIndex = columnCount;
00426 
00427     // column for each cel file
00428     for (int i = 0; i < m_Options.celFiles.size(); i++) {
00429       int cidx=columnCount++;
00430       tsv[f]->defineColumn(0, cidx, Fs::basename(m_Options.celFiles[i]));
00431       tsv[f]->setPrecision(0, cidx, m_Options.m_output_precision);
00432     }
00433     tsv[f]->writeTsv_v1(m_OutFiles[f]);
00434   }
00435 }
00436 
00437 /**
00438  * Do the extraction
00439  */
00440 void CelExtract::extract()
00441 {
00442         bool bDoSaturationReport = false;
00443         if (strstr (m_Options.outFile.c_str (),"SaturationReport"))
00444                 bDoSaturationReport = true;
00445         
00446   // create analysis stream if requested
00447   if (m_Options.analysisString != "")
00448     m_as = newAnalysisStreamObject();
00449 
00450   // cache for probe intensity data
00451   IntensityMart *iMart = NULL;
00452   string diskDir = m_Options.diskDir;
00453   if (m_Options.diskDir == "") {
00454     diskDir = Fs::join(".","temp");
00455   }
00456   if (m_Layout != NULL) {
00457     if (m_Options.useDisk == true) {
00458       DiskIntensityMart* diskMart = 
00459         new DiskIntensityMart(m_ProbeOrder, 
00460                               m_Options.celFiles, 
00461                               m_Options.diskCache * 1048576,
00462                               diskDir, 
00463                               "apt-extract.tmp",
00464                               true);
00465       iMart = diskMart;
00466     } else {
00467       SparseMart* sparseMart = new SparseMart(m_ProbeOrder, 
00468                                               m_Options.celFiles, true);
00469       iMart = sparseMart;
00470     }
00471   } else {
00472     vector<int> order;
00473     for (int pIx = 0; pIx < m_ProbesToDump.size(); pIx++)
00474       order.push_back(pIx);
00475     iMart = new DiskIntensityMart(order, m_Options.celFiles, m_Options.diskCache * 1048576, diskDir, "apt.extract.tmp", true);
00476   }
00477 
00478   // Setup the output file
00479   std::vector<affx::TsvFile*> tsv(m_NumChannels);
00480   defineExtractTsv(tsv,bDoSaturationReport);
00481 
00482   // Iterate over probesets
00483   if (m_Layout != NULL) {
00484     if (m_PsOrder_jhg.size() == 0) {
00485       for (int psIx = 0; psIx < m_Layout->getProbeSetCount(); psIx++) {
00486         //printf("m_PsOrder_jhg:3: %d\n",psIx);
00487         m_PsOrder_jhg.push_back(psIx);
00488       }
00489     }
00490     doProbeSet(iMart, tsv);
00491     // Iterate over probes
00492   } else {
00493     doProbe(iMart, tsv, bDoSaturationReport);
00494   }
00495 
00496   // close analysis stream
00497   if (m_as != NULL)
00498     m_as->finish();
00499 
00500   // close and free output tsv file
00501   for (int f = 0; f < tsv.size(); f++) {
00502     tsv[f]->close();
00503     Freez(tsv[f]);
00504   }
00505 
00506   // free up memory
00507   Freez(iMart);
00508   Freez(m_as);
00509   Freez(m_asFactory);
00510   Freez(m_Layout);
00511 
00512   /* Remove the temp dir if it is empty */
00513   if (Fs::isWriteableDir(diskDir))
00514     Fs::rmdir(diskDir, false);
00515 
00516 }
00517 
00518 void setupAnalysisStreamFactory(AnalysisStreamFactory &aFactory, CelExtractOptions &opts)
00519 {
00520   if (opts.sketchInFile != "") {
00521     Verbose::out(1, "Opening target normalization file: " + Fs::basename(opts.sketchInFile.c_str()));
00522     aFactory.readTargetSketchFromFile(opts.sketchInFile.c_str());
00523   }
00524   if (opts.bgpFile != "") {
00525     Verbose::out(1, "Opening bgp file: " + Fs::basename(opts.bgpFile.c_str()));
00526     aFactory.readControlProbes(opts.bgpFile.c_str());
00527   }
00528 }
00529 
00530 AnalysisStreamExpression *CelExtract::newAnalysisStreamObject()
00531 {
00532 
00533   // Construct the analysis stream factory
00534   AnalysisStreamExpression *as = NULL;
00535   map<string, string> stdMethods; // there are none for this app
00536   string emptyString;
00537   AnalysisStreamFactory *asFactory = new AnalysisStreamFactory(QuantMethodFactory::Expression);
00538 
00539   setupAnalysisStreamFactory(*asFactory, m_Options);
00540 
00541   // Construct the analysis stream
00542   string analysisString = m_Options.analysisString + ",med-polish"; // add quant method, although we won't use it
00543   as = asFactory->constructExpressionAnalysisStream(analysisString.c_str(), *m_Layout, stdMethods, emptyString);
00544 
00545   // get list control probes
00546   vector<Probe *> gcProbes = asFactory->getGcControlProbes();
00547   for (int i = 0; i < gcProbes.size(); i++) {
00548     m_gcProbes.push_back(gcProbes[i]->id);
00549   }
00550 
00551   // We cannot blow away the factory yet as it owns some of the
00552   // memory used in the analysis stream. At a minimum the probes
00553   // instances for the GC background probes are owned by the
00554   // factory.
00555   m_asFactory = asFactory;
00556 
00557   return as;
00558 }
00559 
00560 void CelExtract::doProbeSet(IntensityMart *iMart, std::vector<affx::TsvFile*>& tsv)
00561 {
00562   assert(m_Layout);
00563 
00564   Verbose::out(2, "Reading cel files.");
00565   vector<string> fileCopy = m_Options.celFiles;
00566   CelReader cReader;
00567   cReader.registerIntensityMart(iMart);
00568   if (m_as != NULL)
00569     m_as->registerChipStreamObjs(cReader);
00570   cReader.setFiles(fileCopy);
00571   cReader.readFiles();
00572 
00573   // dump out intensities
00574   unsigned int dotMod = max((int)m_PsOrder_jhg.size() / 40, 1);
00575   Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Dumping intensities", 40, dotMod, m_PsOrder_jhg.size());
00576   for (int index = 0; index < m_PsOrder_jhg.size(); index++) {
00577     Verbose::progressStep(1);
00578 
00579     int psIx = m_PsOrder_jhg[index];
00580     ProbeListPacked pList = m_Layout->getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
00581     ProbeSet *ps = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(pList);
00582 
00583     for (int aIx = 0; aIx < ps->atoms.size(); aIx++) {
00584       unsigned int channelIx = ps->atoms[aIx]->getChannelCode();
00585       for (int plIx = 0; plIx < ps->atoms[aIx]->probes.size(); plIx++) {
00586         if (m_ProbesToDump[ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id]) {
00587           // set probe ID
00588           int columnCount = 0;
00589           tsv[channelIx]->set(0, columnCount++, ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id + 1);
00590 
00591           // set probe x/y
00592           int x = -1, y = -1;
00593           m_Layout->indexToXY(ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id, x, y);
00594           tsv[channelIx]->set(0, columnCount++, x);
00595           tsv[channelIx]->set(0, columnCount++, y);
00596 
00597           tsvSetProbeAnnotations(tsv[channelIx], columnCount, ps, aIx, plIx);
00598 
00599           // set probe intensities
00600           for (int cIx = 0; cIx < m_Options.celFiles.size(); cIx++) {
00601             if (m_as != NULL) {
00602               float pm = - 1;
00603               pm = QuantMethod::transformPrimaryData(ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id, cIx, *iMart, *(m_as->getChipStream()), channelIx);
00604               if (m_Options.pairWithBackground || m_Options.subtractBackground) {
00605                 float mm = -1;
00606                 m_as->getPmAdjuster()->pmAdjustment(ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id, cIx, *iMart, *(m_as->getChipStream()), pm, mm);
00607                 if (m_Options.subtractBackground) {
00608                   tsv[channelIx]->set(0, columnCount++, pm - mm);
00609                 } else {
00610                   tsv[channelIx]->set(0, columnCount++, ToStr((int)pm) + "," + ToStr((int)mm));
00611                 }
00612               } else {
00613                 tsv[channelIx]->set(0, columnCount++, pm);
00614               }
00615             } else {
00616               tsv[channelIx]->set(0, columnCount++,
00617                                   iMart->getProbeIntensity(ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx]->id, cIx, channelIx));
00618             }
00619           }
00620           // write
00621           tsv[channelIx]->writeLevel(0);
00622         } // end if probe to dump
00623       } // end for each probe
00624     } // end for each atom
00625     Freez(ps);
00626   } // end for each probeset
00627   Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00628 }
00629 
00630 void CelExtract::doProbe(IntensityMart *iMart, std::vector<affx::TsvFile*>& tsv, bool bDoSaturationReport/*=false*/)
00631 {
00632         Verbose::out(2, "Reading cel files.");
00633         vector<string> fileCopy = m_Options.celFiles;
00634         CelReader cReader;
00635         cReader.registerIntensityMart(iMart);
00636 
00637         if (m_as != NULL)
00638                 m_as->registerChipStreamObjs(cReader);
00639 
00640         cReader.setFiles(fileCopy);
00641         cReader.readFiles();
00642 
00643         if (bDoSaturationReport == false)
00644         {
00645                 // dump out intensities
00646                 unsigned int dotMod = max((int)m_ProbesToDump.size() / 40, 1);
00647                 Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Dumping intensities", 40, dotMod, m_ProbesToDump.size());
00648                 for (int channelIx = 0; channelIx < m_NumChannels; channelIx++) 
00649                 {
00650                         for (int pIx = 0; pIx < m_ProbesToDump.size(); pIx++) 
00651                         {
00652                                 Verbose::progressStep(1);
00653 
00654                                 if (!m_ProbesToDump[pIx])
00655                                 break;
00656 
00657                                 // set probe ID
00658                                 int columnCount = 0;
00659                                 tsv[channelIx]->set(0, columnCount++, pIx + 1);
00660 
00661                                 // set probe x/y
00662                                 unsigned int x = pIx % (m_NumCols);
00663                                 unsigned int y = pIx / (m_NumCols);
00664                                 tsv[channelIx]->set(0, columnCount++, x);
00665                                 tsv[channelIx]->set(0, columnCount++, y);
00666 
00667                                 // set probe intensities
00668                                 for (int cIx = 0; cIx < m_Options.celFiles.size(); cIx++) 
00669                                 {
00670                                         tsv[channelIx]->set(0,
00671                                                                 columnCount++,
00672                                                                 iMart->getProbeIntensity(pIx, cIx, channelIx));
00673                                 }
00674 
00675                                 if (bDoSaturationReport == false)
00676                                         tsv[channelIx]->writeLevel(0);
00677                         }
00678                 }
00679         } 
00680         else
00681         {  // bDoSaturationReport == true
00682 
00683                 unsigned int dotMod = max((int)m_ProbesToDump.size() / 40, 1);
00684                 Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Computing saturation", 40, dotMod, m_ProbesToDump.size());
00685 
00686                 for (int ifile = 0; ifile < m_Options.celFiles.size(); ifile++)
00687                 {
00688                         for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < m_NumChannels; ichannel++) 
00689                         {
00690                                 int ntotal = 0;
00691                                 int nsat = 0;
00692 
00693                                 for (int ifeature = 0; ifeature < m_ProbesToDump.size(); ifeature++) 
00694                                 {
00695                                         if (iMart->getProbeIntensity (ifeature, ifile, ichannel) > 3800)
00696                                                 nsat++;
00697 
00698                                         ntotal++;
00699                                 }
00700 
00701                                 tsv[ichannel]->set(0,ifile+1,(float)nsat/(float)ntotal);
00702                         }
00703                 }
00704 
00705                 for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < m_NumChannels; ichannel++)
00706                 {
00707                         tsv[ichannel]->writeLevel (0);
00708                 }
00709         }
00710  
00711         Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00712 }
00713 
00714 void CelExtract::tsvSetProbeAnnotations(affx::TsvFile* tsv, int &columnCount, ProbeSet *ps, int aIx, int plIx)
00715 {
00716   if (ps != NULL) {
00717     Probe *p = ps->atoms[aIx]->probes[plIx];
00718 
00719     int block = -1;
00720     int atomSum = 0;
00721     for (int gIx = 0; gIx < ps->numGroups; gIx++) {
00722       int atomsInGroup = ps->atomsPerGroup[gIx];
00723       if (aIx >= atomSum && aIx < atomSum + atomsInGroup) {
00724         block = gIx;
00725         break;
00726       }
00727       atomSum += atomsInGroup;
00728     }
00729 
00730     // set values -- we do not use Probe::stringForType
00731     // as the types are screwed up due to the ProbeList refactor.
00732     // ie every probe is ST (ie PMST) even if it is an AT probe.
00733     string type = "unknown";
00734     if (Probe::isPm(*p))
00735       type = "pm";
00736     else if (Probe::isMm(*p))
00737       type = "mm";
00738     tsv->set(0, columnCount++, type);
00739     tsv->set(0, columnCount++, ps->name);
00740     // detect bogus genotype probesets and change them to expression
00741     if (ps->psType == ProbeSet::GenoType && ps->numGroups != 2 && ps->numGroups != 4) {
00742       // there is a bug in some cdf files where controls are marked as genotyping...
00743       Verbose::out(4, "Labelling probeset " + ToStr(ps->name) + " as expression rather than genotyping because it does not have 2 or 4 groups.");
00744       tsv->set(0, columnCount++, ProbeSet::typeEnumToString(ProbeSet::Expression));
00745     } else {
00746       tsv->set(0, columnCount++, ProbeSet::typeEnumToString(ps->psType));
00747     }
00748     tsv->set(0, columnCount++, block);
00749   } else {
00750     // set null values
00751     for (int i = 0; i < m_FirstCelColIndex; i++)
00752       tsv->set(0, columnCount++, "NULL");
00753   }
00754 }
